discourse_list.title: Solidity Libraries Can Now Have State Variables

content.content: Solidity libraries can now have/create/use/modify state variables using Diamond Storage. See this article about it: https://dev.to/mudgen/solidity-libraries-can-t-have-state-variables-oh-yes-they-can-3ke9
content.GPT-summary: The post explains that Solidity libraries can now have state variables using Diamond Storage and provides a link to an article about it. The post also seems to be advertising the new feature and extending the information to the readers. Additionally, there is no feedback or collaboration mentioned in the post.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Brilliant! This is so useful, I think it needs its own Informational EIP. I have raised a topic about that.
